tr.td: Title:Project SUNBIRD: Supernovae UNmasked By Infra-Red Detection

Co-I(s): Rubina Kotak, Erkki Kankare, Stuart Ryder, Seppo Mattila, Petri Vaisanen, Richard McDermid, Almudena Alonso-Herrero, Andreas Efstathiou, Jari Kotilainen, Miguel Perez-Torres, Sarah Sweet, Zara Randriamanakoto

body.div: The fraction of supernovae missed in optical surveys due to extinction and intrinsic faintness is as much as 50%. We have pioneered the use of Laser Guide Star Adaptive Optics on Gemini to reveal a previously hidden population of core-collapse supernovae in Luminous Infra-Red Galaxies (LIRGs). To measure the fraction of heavily obscured supernovae, high-precision infrared observations are essential. The SUNBIRD (Supernovae UNmasked By Infra-Red Detection) project aims to monitor 18 LIRGs with Gemini South through 2016, and in combination with Keck to increase the sample of obscured supernovae by at least a factor of 5. In just our first observing block in March 2015 we discovered 2 supernovae. The data on the LIRGs themselves will be of immense value to the community for understanding the dusty, starbursting galaxies at high redshift.
